name: unhittable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(especially of a ball) impossible to hit: He unleashed a variety of pitches that were literally unhittable. The target became so small it was unhittable.
sports
  specialized If a bowler or pitcher (= a player who throws the ball in a sports game) is unhittable, it is impossible to hit a ball that they throw: He was an outstanding baseball player, being a virtually unhittable pitcher.
More examplesFewer examplesHe had a fastball that reached 96 mph, and a tantalizing slow curve that was almost unhittable.His trademark was an unhittable slider.The West Indian teams have had some great bowlers, but Ambrose was the most infallibly unhittable of them all.When he's playing at his best, he's virtually unhittable.
